Posts.Content: Sep 29, 2017 02:51PM robbiesgurl wrote: I will keep you in my prayers! My mom has a big lump and is getting her biopsy tomorrow. The only thing that can be done is to take one day at a time. It is hard to be patient and I hate waiting also. My emotions are all over the place and the best thing to do is to keep busy as much as you can and talk to your family when you are feeling nervous. I had a lump about a year ago and was scared. It turned out to be a lipoma (non cancerous fatty lump)
Posts.Title: Right now, waiting is the hardest part... Saighin robbiesgurl

Posts.Content: Oct 2, 2017 05:29PM robbiesgurl wrote: Sorry about that. I will stick to one thread. Thanks for the response.

In which cases would they want it removed right away? Does this mean early stage breast cancer? Log in to post a reply
